newsitem.title: UK: Freight Index drops 10, but Capers seen steady.
newsitem.headline: Freight Index drops 10, but Capers seen steady.

text.p: The Baltic Freight Index (BFI) dropped 10 points to 1,100 on Friday in a London dry cargo freight market weighed down by easier rates for nearby Panamaxes.
Brokers said, however, that while Panamaxes might be a drag on the BFI, Capesize rates still seemed to be holding up.
They also noted a slow build-up of the grain harvest in North America and commented that easier grains prices are likely to tempt buyers soon.
The BFI had got up to 1,119 at the end of last week from a low at 1,060 on August 8.

The US Gulf/Japan route was assessed in the BFI sub-index on Friday at $20.42 after $20.95 on Thursday and $21.10 on Wednesday. Grains fixtures reported on Friday included Militos 54,000 tonnes heavy grains USGulf/Japan at $19.25 with no combination September 6-10 to Dreyfus.

However, brokers said there were inevitably few charterers around with stems that early. Meanwhile, ADM were reported to have fixed at $20.60 with no combination for 54,000/5 tonnes heavy grains US Gulf/Japan for September 25-30.
In the ore trades, brokers pointed to the Tubarao-Rotterdam fixture of 1982-built Hassbat Qatar for mid-September at $6. Biffex futures were again easier in modest volume.
Most-traded September eased by 25 to 1,116 in volume of 129 lots by 1530 GMT.
